verses.text_plain: And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.
verses.verse_html: 1And Isaac called Jacob, and blessed him, and charged him, and said unto him, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan.

tokens.text: unto him, Thou shalt not take

verses.text_plain: Arise, go to Padan–aram, to the house of Bethuel thy mother’s father; and take thee a wife from thence of the daughters of Laban thy mother’s brother.
verses.verse_html: 2Arise, go to Padan–aram, to the house of Bethuel thy mother’s father; and take thee a wife from thence of the daughters of Laban thy mother’s brother.

verses.text_plain: And God Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people;
verses.verse_html:
3And God Almighty bless thee, and make thee fruitful, and multiply thee, that thou mayest be a multitude of people; ▼
▼ a multitude…: Heb. an assembly of people

tokens.text: thee, that thou mayest be a multitude

footnotes.body_text: ▼ a multitude…: Heb. an assembly of people
footnotes.body_html: ▼ a multitude…: Heb. an assembly of people

verses.text_plain: And give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which God gave unto Abraham.
verses.verse_html:
4And give thee the blessing of Abraham, to thee, and to thy seed with thee; that thou mayest inherit the land wherein thou art a stranger, which God gave unto Abraham. ▼
▼ wherein…: Heb. of thy sojournings

tokens.text: to thee, and to thy seed
with thee; that thou mayest inherit

footnotes.body_html: ▼ wherein…: Heb. of thy sojournings

verses.text_plain: And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Padan–aram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob’s and Esau’s mother.
verses.verse_html: 5And Isaac sent away Jacob: and he went to Padan–aram unto Laban, son of Bethuel the Syrian, the brother of Rebekah, Jacob’s and Esau’s mother.

verses.text_plain: When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him away to Padan–aram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;
verses.verse_html: 6When Esau saw that Isaac had blessed Jacob, and sent him away to Padan–aram, to take him a wife from thence; and that as he blessed him he gave him a charge, saying, Thou shalt not take a wife of the daughters of Canaan;

tokens.text: from thence; and that as he blessed
him he gave him a charge

verses.text_plain: And that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Padan–aram;
verses.verse_html: 7And that Jacob obeyed his father and his mother, and was gone to Padan–aram;

verses.text_plain: And Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan pleased not Isaac his father;
verses.verse_html:
8And Esau seeing that the daughters of Canaan pleased not Isaac his father; ▼
▼ pleased…: Heb. were evil in the eyes, etc

footnotes.body_text: ▼ pleased…: Heb. were evil in the eyes, etc
footnotes.body_html: ▼ pleased…: Heb. were evil in the eyes, etc

verses.text_plain: Then went Esau unto Ishmael, and took unto the wives which he had Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham’s son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife.
verses.verse_html:
9Then went Esau unto Ishmael, and took unto the wives which he had Mahalath the daughter of Ishmael Abraham’s son, the sister of Nebajoth, to be his wife. ▼
▼ Mahalath: or, Bashemath

verses.text_plain: And Jacob went out from Beer–sheba, and went toward Haran.
verses.verse_html:
10And Jacob went out from Beer–sheba, and went toward Haran. ▼
▼ Haran: Gr. Charran

verses.text_plain: And he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep.
verses.verse_html: 11And he lighted upon a certain place, and tarried there all night, because the sun was set; and he took of the stones of that place, and put them for his pillows, and lay down in that place to sleep.

verses.text_plain: And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven: and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.
verses.verse_html: 12And he dreamed, and behold a ladder set up on the earth, and the top of it reached to heaven: and behold the angels of God ascending and descending on it.

verses.text_plain: And, behold, the Lord stood above it, and said, I am the Lord God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed;
verses.verse_html: 13And, behold, the Lord stood above it, and said, I am the Lord God of Abraham thy father, and the God of Isaac: the land whereon thou liest, to thee will I give it, and to thy seed;

tokens.text: to thee will I give it

verses.text_plain: And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed.
verses.verse_html:
14And thy seed shall be as the dust of the earth, and thou shalt spread abroad to the west, and to the east, and to the north, and to the south: and in thee and in thy seed shall all the families of the earth be blessed. ▼
▼ spread…: Heb. break forth

tokens.text: and in thee and in thy seed

footnotes.body_html: ▼ spread…: Heb. break forth

verses.text_plain: And, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.
verses.verse_html: 15And, behold, I am with thee, and will keep thee in all places whither thou goest, and will bring thee again into this land; for I will not leave thee, until I have done that which I have spoken to thee of.

verses.text_plain: And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, Surely the Lord is in this place; and I knew it not.
verses.verse_html: 16And Jacob awaked out of his sleep, and he said, Surely the Lord is in this place; and I knew it not.

verses.text_plain: And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful is this place! this is none other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.
verses.verse_html: 17And he was afraid, and said, How dreadful is this place! this is none other but the house of God, and this is the gate of heaven.

verses.text_plain: And Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.
verses.verse_html: 18And Jacob rose up early in the morning, and took the stone that he had put for his pillows, and set it up for a pillar, and poured oil upon the top of it.

verses.text_plain: And he called the name of that place Beth–el: but the name of that city was called Luz at the first.
verses.verse_html:
19And he called the name of that place Beth–el: but the name of that city was called Luz at the first. ▼
▼ Beth–el: that is, The house of God

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Beth–el: that is, The house of God
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Beth–el: that is, The house of God

verses.text_plain: And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,
verses.verse_html: 20And Jacob vowed a vow, saying, If God will be with me, and will keep me in this way that I go, and will give me bread to eat, and raiment to put on,

tokens.text: will be with me, and will keep me

verses.text_plain: So that I come again to my father’s house in peace; then shall the Lord be my God:
verses.verse_html: 21So that I come again to my father’s house in peace; then shall the Lord be my God:

verses.text_plain: And this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God’s house: and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee.
verses.verse_html: 22And this stone, which I have set for a pillar, shall be God’s house: and of all that thou shalt give me I will surely give the tenth unto thee.

tokens.text: and of all that thou shalt give
